channel.title: Java Runtime Environment
channel.description: I am using Ubuntu 6.06 and... I have downloaded all the Java RE's and I don't know what to do with them, or get it installed. I just want to try RS in Lunix(also i completely messed up my back-up drive(114 gigs of my stuff... :( ) ) so please help..

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

you have to do more than uncomment them, you also have to add multiverse (or universe) in there

Read full topic

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well, questions mean they have an ability to learn, unless they are doing it to be annoying like asking “Why?” 20 times in a row. However this topic is starting to slip off-Topic.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 12, 2007, 09:01:52 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:48281”]Then it isn’t enabled.

The packages are called ‘sun-java6-jre’ or 'sun-java5-jre[/quote]

well I uncommented them in addept, I added them in addept, however, I still can’t even load the runescape window(for testing) and “sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jre” couldn’t find the package.

Read full topic

Secondly, do you think that Studio 8 could be installed on Linux, and runned via Wine??[br][size=1]Posted on: April 12, 2007, 08:18:54 PM[/size][hr]Also, what about flash? item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

sudo apt-get install firefox

edit: you can install kubuntu from inside of ubuntu with:

sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop

item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade

To make sure everything is the same version.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

For one, it says that the X-server is a different(higher) version than the NVidia driver was made for(latest) and therefore cannot configure screens correctly and then replies no screen(s) found, which is stupid because otherwise it wouldn’t show it. It works by the Beryl tutorial on Ubuntu 6.10 durring runtime, but after restart, it goes… goiwhroighwoigh0w9iuy3t-ej~!!@!)R~~~!(randomly types characters to express the computer just crapping its self
.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

writes it down to use in Linux safe Mode

Thankyou, I will add on the news. Beryl is really cool, however, the terminal doesn’t work anymore and some things just get blacked out, is this Java or Beryl that is causing the problem?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 11, 2007, 08:58:23 PM[/size][hr]Ok, I finaly got it to work, not I gota install back the drivers(that wasn’t what messed up) so that I can get out of this super-small res.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 11, 2007, 09:58:23 PM[/size][hr]apparently it is the drivers, but why do they crash the X-server when starting up, but not after Ctrl + Alt + BKSPC?

Read full topic

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote="/etc/X11/xorg.conf"]# If you have edited this file but would like it to be automatically updated

again, run the following command:

sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Java Runtime Environment
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well they were checkmarked, I also have another request, as I broke Linux, I was trying to get it to do more than one screen, For some reason when I restarted it wont work because It says that It can find a screen(s) but have no configuration or something, and then says No Screen(s) found. Any way I could restore the X-server;s configuration thru TTY?

Read full topic

item.title: Java Runtime Environment

The packages are called ‘sun-java6-jre’ or 'sun-java5-jre
